alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Morrill; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 21 at 5:19AM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Extremely dangerous wind chills likely, along with some light snowfall. Total snow accumulations up to 2 inches possible. Wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero likely. * WHERE...Morrill, Box Butte, and southern Sioux Counties in the Nebraska Panhandle including Bridgeport, Alliance, Hemingford, and Agate. * WHEN...5 PM MST this evening through 11 AM MST Thursday February 24th. Best chance for accumulating snowfall today through early Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in 5 minutes or less. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. In addition, some roadways may become slick or snow covered where heavier snow falls.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
